item.title: Escape Room Fun
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: The Schmitz lab took a break from the bench and teamed up for some puzzle-solving fun at our latest outing.

item.title: Alex is a NIH Genetics Training Grant fellow!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Alex Tadros for being selected as a 2025-26 NIH Genetics Training Grant fellow! Way to go!

item.title: Congratulations, Dr. Yao!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Big congrats to Nan — now officially Dr. Yao! We're so proud and can't wait to see what's next for you!

item.title: Plant Center Retreat 2024 Awardees
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to the Plant Center Retreat 2024 poster winners! Ankush won 1st place in the graduate student section and Ziliang won 1st place in the postdoc/staff section. Nice work!

item.title: Hats off to Cullan for winning NIH training grant two years in row!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Cullan Meyer has been selected by the NIH Genetics training grant committee as a recipient of a 2023-2024 training fellowship! Bravo!

item.title: 2023 CURO Symposium
item.dc:subject: News

item.title: Poster winners at the Plant Center Retreat!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Sohyun Bang (3rd) and Mark Minow (2nd) for their poster awards in the student and postdoc competitions at The Plant Center Retreat!

item.title: Pablo Mendieta wins a Doctoral Dissertation Improvement Grant!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Pablo Mendieta was awarded a Doctoral Dissertation Improvement Grant from The Plant Center.

item.title: Aryan Thakur is a CURO Fellow
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Aryan Thakur wins Spring 2023 CURO Research Award! Congratulations, Aryan!

item.title: Cullan wins NIH Genetics Training Grant
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Cullan Meyer wins a position on the NIH Genetics Training Grant for 2022-2023. Congratulations, Cullan!

item.title: 2022 Blavatnik National Awards Finalist
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Bob is a finalist for the 2022 Blavatnik National Awards for Young Scientists, the world's largest unrestricted prize honoring early-career scientists and engineers.

item.title: Sohyun Bang wins the Summer Research Grant
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations Sohyun Bang for winning the Summer Research Grant for 2022! Keep up the good work!

item.title: Pablo wins the Linton and June Bishop Fellowship!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Pablo Mendieta has been awarded the 2021-2022 Linton and June Bishop Fellowship by the Genetics Graduate Affairs Committee. Congratulations, Pablo!

item.title: Congratulations Faheem Pottayil for winning the 2021 Presidential Award of Excellence!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Faheem has been selected as one of a select few UGA undergraduate students to receive this year's Presidential Award of Excellence! Keep up the good work, Faheem! We are proud of you.

item.title: Callan Russell is the recipient of the 2020 Cynthia Kenyon Award!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Callan for winning the 2020 Cynthia Kenyon Award, given to one outstanding graduating UGA senior majoring in Genetics. Callan is heading to Stanford as a Knight-Hennessey Scholar. Well done!

item.title: Sohyun Bang wins 2019 UGA Capturing Science Contest!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Sohyun Bang and Michael Francis won second place for their DNA signification entry Music of Life in the 2019 UGA Capturing Science Contest! Congratulations, Sohyun!

item.title: Madge Stuhlreyer is a CURO fellow!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Madge for being awarded a Spring 2020 CURO Research Assistantship! Way to go!

item.title: Sarah Saddoris is a Goldwater Scholar
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Sarah Saddoris was awarded the prestigious Goldwater Scholarship. Keep up the fantastic scholarly and research activity.

item.title: Faheem is a CURO fellow!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Faheem for being awarded a Summer CURO Research Assistantship!

item.title: NSF GRFP awards
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to former undergraduates Patrick Griffin who was awarded an NSF-GRFP and Kitra Cates who received an honorable mention.

item.title: Lexiang does it again!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Lexiang was awarded the Ying Xu Outstanding Student Paper Award from the Institute of Bioinformatics.

item.title: Pablo is an NIH Training Grant Awardee!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations to Pablo for being awarded a position on the departmental NIH Training Grant. Excellent job!
This is not an April Fools joke.

item.title: Callan earned a summer internship
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: We are so excited for Callan Russell who was the only person selected out of 55 individuals to participate in the genetic counseling internship at the University of South Carolina.

item.title: Plant Center Poster Awardees
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: The Plant Center fall retreat had 98 posters this year and William Jordan placed 2nd in the graduate student poster category and Jered Wendte placed 2nd in the postdoc category. Well done!

item.title: Callan is a CURO Fellow
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Callan was the recipient of a CURO Research Fellowship. Well done!

item.title: Department Retreat Awardees
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Well done Tina and Zach for their awards for their poster presentations at the departmental retreat!

item.title: Jered is an NSF PD Fellow
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Jered was awarded a 3 year fellowship from the National Plant Genome Initiative funded by the NSF. Congratulations, Jered!

item.title: Will is an NIH TG Awardee
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Will for being awarded a position on the departmental NIH Training Grant. Well deserved.

item.title: Well deserved award to Lexiang Ji
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Lexiang Ji was awarded the "Outstanding Self-Financed Students Abroad" by the China Scholarship Council.

item.title: Brigitte is the 2018 Xu Award Winner
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Brigitte for being awarded the Ying Xu Outstanding Student Paper Award from the Institute of Bioinformatics

item.title: William Jordan is awarded an IIRG
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations William for being awarded an Innovative and Interdisciplinary Research Grant from the UGA Graduate School

item.title: Poster Award Winners
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Kudos to William Jordan who placed 1st in the graduate student poster competition at UGA's Plant Center retreat and to Adam who placed 3rd within the postdoc category.

item.title: Chad's a new Assistant Professor
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Chad has accepted a position as an Assistant Professor at Michigan State University. Congratulations! Best of luck with your new adventure.

item.title: NIH Training grant awardees
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Brigitte and Will for being awarded a position on the NIH departmental NIH Training Grant. Keep up the great work.

item.title: Lexiang wins Ying Xu Price
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Lexiang for being awarded the Ying Xu Outstanding Student Paper Award from the Institute of Bioinformatics.

item.title: FASTmC
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Adam and others have developed a novel set of models to estimate context-specific methylation levels in any sample regardless of the availability of a reference genome. See manuscript at BioRxiv.

item.title: Brigitte is a new NIH Fellow
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Brigitte for being awarded an NIH Training Grant Fellowship for her studies of plant epimutations.

item.title: Pat Griffin - Cynthia Kenyon Awardee
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Pat was named the Cynthia Kenyon Awardee at the Genetics Graduation Event. This award recognizes a student based on excellence in academics, research and leadership. This is well deserved. Congratulations Pat!

item.title: Nice new study by Pat Griffin
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Pat just submitted his study that he started as an undergraduate. Taught himself programming with help from the lab. Nice work. bioRxiv

item.title: Study on natural variation of mC from the lab
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Another preprint from the lab on extensive natural variation of DNA methylation between angiosperm species bioRxiv

item.title: New study on gbM
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: A truly collaborative effort put forth to understand the origins and evolutionary consequences of gene body DNA methylation in plant genomes. bioRxiv

item.title: CURO Research Assistantship awarded to Madeline
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Madeline Steffensen for being awarded a 2015 CURO Research Assistantship.

item.title: Kitra awarded a CURO RA
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Kitra Cates for being awarded a 2015 CURO Research Assistantship.

item.title: 4mC-TAB-seq
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: In collaboration with the lab of Chuan He at the University of Chicago we've created a novel method to identify N4-methylcytosines in bacterial genomes. Great job Miao and Lexiang!

item.title: Pew Scholar in Biomedical Sciences
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Bob was named a Pew Scholar and the lab received funding from the Pew Charitable Trusts to support research on epigenetic variants.

item.title: Drexel sets off for medical school
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: We're sad to see our all-star technician leave the lab today, but we're happy he is taking the next step in his career. Good luck!

item.title: Genome-wide establishment of mouse methylation
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Productive and fun collaboration with Steen Ooi's lab at UCL on establishment of DNA methylation patterns during spermatogenesis. Online today in Cell Reports.

item.title: Plant Methylome DB (Updated)
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: We are announcing at #PAGXXIII the release of an updated version of Plant Methylome DB, which includes 20 unpublished DNA methylomes.

item.title: Welcome Brigitte Hofmeister
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Brigitte has joined our lab and the Institute of Bioinformatics. Welcome!

item.title: Caution with WGBS data
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Ji L, Sasaki T, Sun X, Ma P, Lewis ZA, Schmitz RJ. (2014) Methylated DNA is over-represented in whole-genome bisulfite sequencing data. Frontiers in Genetics 5:341. doi: 10.3389/fgene.2014.00341

item.title: Pat does it again...
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Pat Griffin for being awarded a CURO Research Assistantship!

item.title: Maize Epigenomics
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Read our new study led by Pat West (a superstar undergraduate) and Qing Li from Nathan Springer's Lab at UM… Genomic distribution of H3K9me2 and DNA methylation in a maize genome. PLOS ONE Aug;9(8):e105267

item.title: New Review with Nathan Springer's Group
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Eichten S, Schmitz RJ, Springer NM. (2014) Epigenetics; beyond chromatin modifications and complex gene regulatory systems. Plant Physiology Jul 165(3):993-947.

item.title: Welcome Xiuling
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: We're happy that Dr. Xiuling Shi has finally joined our group. We hope you enjoy your new home.

item.title: Pat's a CURO Fellow
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Congratulations to Patrick Griffin who will be a CURO Fellow in the lab this summer.

item.title: Congratulations Chad!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Chad was awarded a 3 year fellowship from the National Plant Genome Initiative funded by the NSF. Nice work!

item.title: Review Time
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Chad's review on the inheritance of DNA methylation variants in plant genomes is out.

item.title: Welcome Kelly!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: Welcome Kelly Lane to our lab as the first graduate students from the Genetics Department!

item.title: Postdoc position available
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: We're looking for a new postdoctoral fellow to join our team. See the ad.

item.title: We have a website!
item.dc:subject: News
item.content:encoded: The website is up and running and we are looking for people interested in joining our group in Fall 2013.
